title: EastEnders star Natalie Cassidy's incredible body transformation after overhauling her lifestyle
text:

EastEnders' Natalie Cassidy has reportedly lost three stone after embarking on a new healthy lifestyle.

Recently the actress, who plays Sonia Fowler in the popular ITV soap, has been showing off a new trimmer figure after shaping up this summer.

The 36-year-old soap star has been no stranger to diets in the past and wowed fans when she whipped herself into shape and shared her tips with her fitness DVD, 2007’s Natalie Cassidy's Then and Now Workout.

(Image: SplashNews.com)

Natalie's weight loss had not always been the healthiest and in 2009, she revealed her desire to keep slim was so extreme that she was "bordering on having an eating disorder".

She opened up about her struggles in an interview with Heat magazine at the time.

She said: "There were nights I would go out for dinner and then I'd go home and take laxatives because I didn't want the food inside me."

Over the years, Natalie has continued to fluctuate from a size 16 down to a size 4-6 at her smallest.

However, the star is now happier and healthier than ever before after yo-yo dieting and then reclaiming her figure by losing three stone over the past three years .

(Image: James Curley / Rex Features)

(Image: REX)

Natalie has transformed her lifestyle and turned uber healthy with a new diet and exercise plan.

Last year, Natalie shared an insight behind her body ambitions. that after playing Sonia for 12 years, she had a desire to overhaul her image.

Ahead of running the London Marathon this year alongside her EastEnders ' co-stars, the brunette beauty told The Sun about her new-found body confidence .

She said: "I have learnt how to eat and how to be comfortable with who I am ... You get wiser as you get older and I just feel much more confident and comfortable."

Natalie completed the London Marathon 2019, in honour of her co-star, Barbara Windsor. While she was training, Natalie often used Twitter to share posts and videos of her running. In one post, she revealed she ran 18-miles in one day in preparation.

Natalie, who has daughters Eliza, eight, and Joanie, two, clearly worked hard to get marathon ready.

As well as following her training regime and regular exercise, the soap star also made some changes to her diet. She previously admitted that "cheese, crisps and dips were her downfall", but by cutting out this "rubbish", she managed to stay in shape.

(Image: PA)

An inside source close to the star revealed to Now magazine that Nataline had "sworn off take outs", to mantain her super-strict eating regime.

The 35-year-old actress is best known for play trumpet loving Sonia Fowler in EastEnders - a role she has held down since she was just a child in 1993.

The mum-of-two has also appeared on screens competing in shows including Strictly Come Dancing and Celebrity Big Brother .
description: The Sonia Fowler actress overhauled her lifestyle - and her body - with a new diet, running regime and a fast food ban
